name: Chiodos
description: '''Chiodos''' ({{IPAc-en|lang|tʃ|iː|ˈ|oʊ|d|oʊ|z}}, {{IPA|it|ˈkjɔːdos}}) is an American [[post-hardcore]] band from [[Davison, Michigan]]. Formed in 2001, the group was originally known as "The Chiodos Bros," the band's name was a tribute to filmmakers [[The Chiodo Brothers|Stephen, Charles, and Edward Chiodo]], responsible for the film ''[[Killer Klowns from Outer Space]]''. Chiodos released their first full-length album, titled ''[[All's Well That Ends Well (Chiodos album)|All's Well That Ends Well]]'', on July 26, 2005. Their second album, ''[[Bone Palace Ballet]]'', was released in North America on September 4, 2007 and debuted at number 5 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and number 1 on the [[Independent Albums]]. [[Warner Bros. Records]] released ''Bone Palace Ballet'' on January 26, 2009, as part of a new distribution deal in the [[United Kingdom|UK]]. They released their third studio album, ''[[Illuminaudio]]'' in 2010, and it was the only studio album to feature [[Brandon Bolmer]] as lead vocalist and Tanner Wayne as drummer. The band released their fourth and final album, ''[[Devil (Chiodos album)|Devil]]'' on April 1, 2014, which marked the return of original vocalist Craig Owens and drummer Derrick Frost.
